data.sentence: The word لَا comes from the root ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: Becoming separated, severed, disunited, cut off or distinctApparent, manifest, plain, clear, known, distinguished from anotherDisunion and unionComing forthSeparation or division between two things (e.g. land)An evidence, an indication, demonstration, proof, argument that is clear, manifest (intellectual or perceptive/perceived by sense), testimony of a witness
data.sentence: The word بَيْنَهُمَا comes from the root ب ي ن and is associated with the meanings: Becoming separated, severed, disunited, cut off or distinctApparent, manifest, plain, clear, known, distinguished from anotherDisunion and unionComing forthSeparation or division between two things (e.g. land)An evidence, an indication, demonstration, proof, argument that is clear, manifest (intellectual or perceptive/perceived by sense), testimony of a witness

data.meanings: a thing that intervenes between two things, a bar/obstruction that makes a separation, the interval between the present and that which is to come, from the period of the death to the resurrection, what is between doubt and certainty.
data.sentence: The word بَرْزَخٌ comes from the root ب ر ز خ and is associated with the meanings: a thing that intervenes between two things, a bar/obstruction that makes a separation, the interval between the present and that which is to come, from the period of the death to the resurrection, what is between doubt and certainty.

data.meanings: Sought for or after, desired, endeavored to find and take and get (good or evil)Loving or affecting a thingActing wrongfully, injuriously or tyrannicallySeeking or endeavoring to act corruptingly, wrongly and/or unjustly, insolent/disobedientExceeding due bounds or just limits in any wayNot right, proper or fitProstitute or adulteress, unchaste [e.g. 19:20, 19:28, 24:33]Not seeking what one should not seekSeeking game or preyPlace where a thing is sought, way or manner in which a thing is sought
data.sentence: The word يَبْغِيَانِ comes from the root ب غ ي and is associated with the meanings: Sought for or after, desired, endeavored to find and take and get (good or evil)Loving or affecting a thingActing wrongfully, injuriously or tyrannicallySeeking or endeavoring to act corruptingly, wrongly and/or unjustly, insolent/disobedientExceeding due bounds or just limits in any wayNot right, proper or fitProstitute or adulteress, unchaste [e.g. 19:20, 19:28, 24:33]Not seeking what one should not seekSeeking game or preyPlace where a thing is sought, way or manner in which a thing is sought
